website_summaries.verdict: Nice size for a charcoal chimney that features a shorter shell so it will fit small grills well.
pros: Contains a two-handle design that allows you to control the pouring of lit charcoal more effectively and accurately
Uses a heat shield to protect the handle and keep it safe to touch
Uses aluminized steel to last a long time
cons: Takes a while to light all of the charcoal if you overload the chimney

customer_reviews.title: Come on baby, light my fire
customer_reviews.text: This is my second large Weber starter. It works as it should. My first one lasted 10 years. I particularly like the extra handle that allows two-handed pouring. I have looked at many other chimney starters and this is the best value IMHO. Tips: Use kraft paper like grocery bag pieces or parts of your charcoal bag and a starter cubes like Katon Cubes and you will have a quick fire. Pay attention when you empty hot coals to get all of them out of the chimney!!!! This goes for any chimney starter.
customer_reviews.author: beemers&brats

customer_reviews.title: Must-Have for Charcoal Grilling
customer_reviews.text: I'm ashamed of myself for using lighter fluid after having bought this. I've been grilling for years and never knew about this simple invention and I regret not having found it sooner. It's so simple to use! Insert charcoal in cylinder, stuff some newspaper in the bottom from underneath, light newspaper and wait 10 minutes or so then dump it into your grill. I light mine inside my grill on top of the charcoal grate so as not to damage my concrete driveway, then dump it right into the grill. To me, this is easier than using lighter fluid or having to stack my charcoal like my father taught me. This is hands down my favorite grilling accessory.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua Storme King

customer_reviews.title: beat the crap out of it then replace and dispose
customer_reviews.text: This is my second one. The first one has a couple bolts were the rivets failed. I bought this again simply because I can't find anyone making a more durable product worth paying more for. Since the more expensive stuff is junk too, I might as well buy cheap, beat the crap out of it then replace and dispose. If this is you're first time buying, the metal is pretty thin, keep an eye on the rivets, and don't expect it to make last more than 2 years.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Oh WOW!
customer_reviews.text: Twist newspaper and place it in a circle around the bottom inside edge, ensuring that some of the ends stick out of the holes at the bottom on the side of the chimney; place your coals/briquettes/wood on top inside the chimney; light the paper that is sticking out through the holes at the bottom outside of the chimney, and just wait! Perfect, EVERY time. You end up with nice, evenly burnt coals that you then empty out of the chimney into your grill (wearing thick gloves of course as the handle WILL be hot!). Refuse to charcoal grill/smoke without these!
customer_reviews.author: SaxplayernTX

customer_reviews.title: Great build quality, diameter a bit too large
customer_reviews.text: This version is much better made than the one I got from Home Depot. The walls are thicker and the whole unit is more sturdy. The only problem is the diameter is a bit large, causing me to have to use more charcoal than necessary to ensure it piles on top of the electric fire starter inside the chimney. There is no release gate at the bottom, so you have to turn it upside down and dump the embers into the grill. This can get a bit tricky with an Akorn "egg" grill because of the deep charcoal grate, but doable. Otherwise, great product!
customer_reviews.author: Ben M.

customer_reviews.title: Save yourself a half hour by getting this
customer_reviews.text: What was I doing without this? Simple to use, and heats charcoal very quickly and evenly. I don't see how I ever started 4 inch lump charcoal without this. This gets my large coals heated up in 5 minutes so I can start my grilling/smoking much more quickly and get back to the guests. Also eliminates the need to buy lighter fluid and the like. Just add 3-4 pieces of paper to the bottom light once, even on the windiest days. Also, for those lonely nights, just throw a few coals in the bottom and a small grid up top and you can cook up a personal steak in just a few minutes without dirtying the grill.
customer_reviews.author: mateo

customer_reviews.title: Simple and fast
customer_reviews.text: Love it. Fast and easy and perfect for initial filling of 22” Weber charcoal grill. I don’t light my charcoal in the grill anymore as in the chimney you use a piece of newspaper to ignite and the grill requires propane starter ($$). I light it on concrete patio, no issues.
customer_reviews.author: Fiveboyd

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for getting your BBQs started quicker
customer_reviews.text: If you're cooking with charcoal briquettes than this is a must have. I used to do it the old fashioned way heating charcoal on the open grill and did not realize how inefficient it was until I discovered this tool. This cuts the heat up time significantly so you can get your grill on and ready much quicker. Definitely necessary when you're cooking alot of food so there's less downtime when adding more charcoal on the grill.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Be careful!
customer_reviews.text: Large capacity was nice but the handle melted when I used it the first time. Also that handle isn't heat proof at all to the touch. My old one was heat proof. Wooden. This one melted to my hand and to my oven mitt that I ended up needing to use. I'll try it one more time and if I hate it I'll return it.
customer_reviews.author: Kimbles

customer_reviews.title: Efficient and effective. Possible witchcraft is involved.
customer_reviews.text: So you know how when you have a BBQ, inevitably what happens is the guy who owns the grill will start the coals and at least 2 other people will join to try to explain to them how they could be doing it better? Yeah , I'm talking about you Ben and Jack! I know how to light god damn coals! It's not that god damn hard! Leave your unsolicited advice to yourself! Yeah but this thing works really fast so those two won't be able to bicker at you for very long before you dump the coals. Now if only they would stop pestering me about how to best cook meat on my own grill...
customer_reviews.author: average joe

customer_reviews.title: Won't go without it
customer_reviews.text: I'll never grill without one again. No need for lighter fluid (which, for me, kind of ruins the great odors of barbecuing). Just put some paper underneath, light it, and you'll have a raging chimney full of coals in 10 minutes. You do have to be careful when dumping the coals onto the grill. Although not necessary, I wore my grilling gloves when doing it. I will say that if you have a larger grill, you need more than one chimney full of coals, but what I do is empty the first load and place fresh charcoal on the pile of lit coals. They burn fast on that hot pile, and then can be smoothed out into a layer.
customer_reviews.author: Apollinaire

customer_reviews.title: Waaay better than starter fluid!!
customer_reviews.text: WOW, this thing works great! I used half of a brown paper grocery bag instead of newspaper. It initially didn't seem like it was doing anything, but after about 5 mins I could hear it crackling and could feel the heat. About 15-20 mins later I had perfect coals. It does get really hot, so if your hands are kinda wimpy you may need to wear gloves when pouring out the coals. Also plan ahead for some place to set if after you dump it, it will still be quite hot.
customer_reviews.author: Brian Parr

customer_reviews.title: Amazing tool for a beginner!
customer_reviews.text: I have never grilled before in my life. I was so worried about getting the charcole started and it staying lit. I did a ton of research online and I decided that buying this chimney would be my best option and boy was a right! All I had to do was crumple up three sheets of newspaper underneath, fill the top with charcole light it and wait!! I still cant believe it was that easy. I didn’t need any lighter fluid and my coals stayed lit for well over an hour. They might have lasted longer but I was more than done with them by then. Honeslty one of the smartest and easiest things I’ve bought in a while!
customer_reviews.author: Carrisa Ammons

customer_reviews.title: The only way you should be starting your coals!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little chimney starter, and the only way you should be lighting coals (light fluid is nasty and shouldn't be used around food... at least not good food...period). I fill this up and put it over top of a little propane burner, light the burner, and 30 seconds later, move it to the grill to get hot. Smaller chunks can get stuck in the grate at the bottom so you need to give it a little shake when dumping into the grill. For $14, you can't beat it.
customer_reviews.author: Shane

customer_reviews.title: Great alternative to starter fluid
customer_reviews.text: So much easier than using starter fluid. Put some newspaper drizzled with cooking oil in the bottom section, charcoal on top, place on the grill and light. The oil on the paper burns first keeping the paper from immediately going up in flames. Then the paper burns. After only 10 mins or so the charcoal is ready to be dumped out into the grill.....wear gloves it will be hot.
customer_reviews.author: Sttomper

customer_reviews.title: Best chimney starter I've used- very efficient
customer_reviews.text: Best chimney starter I've used- very efficient, and dumps without drama. I'm on my second one; the first lasted 4-5 years; eventually, large flakes of metal start peeling off, but this seems to happen with all of these devices; perhaps one could be made of stainless steel, but they're not expensive and replacing every few years is not a hardship. One note- most literature recommends placing the starter on a grate; I've found that it works better for me placed on a solid surface (such as a patio).
customer_reviews.author: Old Unc

customer_reviews.title: Another Great Weber Product!
customer_reviews.text: This Weber Chimney product has given me many years of great service. This is my second, which is a replacement to the one I recently gave to my youngest son. I use the large area for my Weber Kettle, and flip it over to use the small side for lighting my Weber Smokey Mountain. The only constructive feedback I have is that Weber is a great US company that makes many super fantastic products, and I can only imagine how much better I’d feel about buying them if they were made here in America.
customer_reviews.author: Drew

customer_reviews.title: The bomb!!!!! Where have you been all my life!!!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is unbelievable! just take a look at the picture!!! It's so easy. I took the paper that the chimney came packed in and shoved it underneath the chimney, set it in the grill, then lit a small little piece of the paper on fire, and within 12 minutes you got a roaring fire. Check out the picture! End the struggle and make your life easy again. buy this thing and you will never regret it! Neither will the people waiting to eat because you can't get the fire started! It was super windy when I took this picture and it made no difference at all!! It was so easy!
customer_reviews.author: atubbs

customer_reviews.title: My last one lasted over 6 years and I used it all the time. My first burn in the new one.
customer_reviews.text: I don't get the liberal newspaper but paper towels work just as good to get it stared. I only use a little charcoal to get the pecan logs going. This time I moved these once lit to my smoker and made a brisket. I use the same process to like my Weber grill using the same logs. Oh so good!!!!!! BTW Time for me to get a new Weber grill as well. They are the best in the world and mine is getting OLD.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Hicks

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Idea
customer_reviews.text: I have used this charcoal started since last summer and have really enjoyed using it. It is very easy to use. Simply put charcoal briquettes into the chimney, put paper (not too much) in the cavern underneath, and then light the newspaper. Within 15 to 20 minutes, you have a well lit charcoal grill. It makes food taste better, as so many have went to using the charcoal briquettes that have the lighter fluid in it already. However, those tend to make food have an off taste. This product allows you to very easily start a charcoal grill and get great results.
customer_reviews.author: Baking GirlTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Too good for my taste!
customer_reviews.text: Excellent. Nearly set the bloody house on fire, but aside from it's extraordinary capacity for enhancing a fire, it does exactly what it's suppose to do. Mind you -- I used it on my deck -- which is where everyone in my development puts their BBQ. But the slight breeze had the licks of flames getting too-close for my comfort to my siding. I wont be using it again --but I can assure any bbq-bravehearts that this gadget will hasten their coals !
customer_reviews.author: Andie

customer_reviews.title: Better than advertised charcoal starter chimney!
customer_reviews.text: Heavy duty! In less than twenty minutes, delivers a full bed of burning charcoal briquets ready to cook a huge meal on your grill! No starter fluids needed that can ruin the taste of your food. Just some newspaper pages, charcoal, and one match. I followed their easy instructions and it works like a charm every time! Well worth it. Well made. Healthier than using chemicals in or on your charcoal. My son showed me this one! Really appreciate his recommend.
customer_reviews.author: John Murray

customer_reviews.title: Must have tool for charcoal grilling!
customer_reviews.text: If you are using a charcoal grill then do yourself a favor and get one of these! It will take your grilling to a whole new level! It gets all of your charcoal fired up for a constant and controllable heat. I have also used it to great effect as a stand alone charcoal rocket stove, and put a little grate on the top for searing steaks that have been cooked sous vides. It is much faster than using the searzall, plus you get the charcoal flavor in your steak!
customer_reviews.author: Daryl

customer_reviews.title: This really does work!!
customer_reviews.text: We took our first camping trip in years and got this for my husband because he likes to cook. Couldn't get over how big it is and how much better it is than those sold in local home improvement stores. My husband was a bit apprehensive that I'd bought "another unnecessary gadget" but when he went to start the charcoal for the first time all I heard was "wow...this thing really works. Look how fast it heats these coals!" I just smiled. Needless to say, he loves it. You can add as many coals as you need. A couple of crumbled sheets of newspaper underneath and you've got hot coals in no time. Happy campers recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: janfTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Nice
customer_reviews.text: Works well the added feature of a rubber/plastic handle made it even better. My only concern was the wide gauge mesh the charcoal sits on. It looks like it would work GREAT for standard 'square' charcoal brickets, but chunk/lump charcoal is a bit of a challenge. Unless you get a bag of chunk/lump charcoal of larger and uniform size (at least the size of the squares), the smaller pieces fall through the grate. My workaround will be to purchase higher-quality lump/chunk charcoal in the future
customer_reviews.author: W Bee

customer_reviews.title: Nice!
customer_reviews.text: Well engineered and heavy duty, won't need to buy again for several years but will definitely stick with this product. Not only is it fast, the coals heat evenly and we've saved so much money, no more buying lighter fluid- just a few sheets of newspaper. There are other chimneys out there and we like others have used a souped up coffee can too but this is so much better! Nice enough to give as a gift--we bought ours as a Father's Day for gift for dad and was glad we did!
customer_reviews.author: AJTop Contributor: Baseball

customer_reviews.title: Perfect chimney starter
customer_reviews.text: This is an excellent chimney starter. It has a large capacity and is a great value. Please, please, please be careful. It gets very hot, very fast. The handle stayed nice and cool, but I would not go near this without gloves. In terms of a chimney starter, I removed the grate of my Weber grill and placed the chimney starter on top of a crumpled piece of newspaper. I lit the paper and within seconds, the heat moved its way up the chimney starter. In under 10 minutes, all of charcoal briquettes were red and hot. I nervously tipped over the coals into the grill and moved the starter far away from the area until cooled.
customer_reviews.author: Oliver Wood

customer_reviews.title: Very good at starting coals for my smoker
customer_reviews.text: The Prodigy had this in mind when they wrote their lyrics I'm the trouble starter, punkin' instigator. I'm the fear addicted, danger illustrated. I'm a firestarter, twisted firestarter. You're a firestarter, twisted firestarter. I'm a firestarter, twisted firestarter. I'm the bitch you hated, filth infatuated. Yeah! I'm the pain you tasted, fell intoxicated. I'm a firestarter, twisted firestarter. You're the firestarter, twisted firestarter. I'm the self inflicted, mind detonator. Yeah! I'm the one infected, twisted animator. I'm a firestarter, twisted firestarter. You're the firestarter, twisted firestarter. I'm a firestarter, twisted firestarter starter
customer_reviews.author: Abi

customer_reviews.title: What a waste of time I spend before I found these
customer_reviews.text: All the years I tried starting charcoal I never knew these things existed. What a waste of time I spend before I found these.. Two wadded up pieces of newspaper on the bottom will start the charcoal and all the heat is funneled up to the layers on top. Takes about 10 minutes such a great product. Not sure if they make one or not but would be cool if you could push a button and make the charcoal fall out the bottom rather than pouring it out . No big deal but would be better.
customer_reviews.author: F. Paul Maloney

customer_reviews.title: The only way to get your coals going
customer_reviews.text: Save yourself the headache of making little pyramids of charcoal and futzing with lighter fluid and all that. If you have a charcoal grill, you cannot make a better investment than a coal starter chimney. It is a completely fool-proof way to get your coals going and a huge time saver. This is a very nice model and holds a large enough amount of of coals for a smaller grill. It cannot be easier to use - just load the top up with coals, stick some paper in the bottom, light it on fire, wait until the coals on top are white, then dump it out into your grill. Works every time without fail.
customer_reviews.author: hothotpot

customer_reviews.title: Love It - Makes Charcoal Grilling So Much Safer !!
customer_reviews.text: When my chimney charcoal starter arrived today and I opened the box, my first thought was, "Where am I going to store THIS??" It's pretty big, I had not noticed the dimensions on it when I ordered. I ordered it because Weber, the mfr. of my grill, said it was far superior and far safer to start charcoal this way. Today is only the third time in my life I have ever built a fire in a grill, so I needed all the help I could get. I used a fire starter pod under my chimney and my charcoal (not the easy light kind, either) was blazing in less than three minutes! Amazingly convenient.
customer_reviews.author: TexasG

customer_reviews.title: Fast and efficient way to get the charcoal going
customer_reviews.text: I got this based on my cousin in law's recommendation. This is my first charcoal grill and he told me to get this. Took me all but a few minutes to figure it out. actual usage: lights up quick and looks great. I love the dual handles and it helps a lot to be able to get support. for a first time user, i didn't realize how big this thing was, but it was massive. Nothing bad about it, just took me by surprise on receiving the starter and as someone who's never ever grilled before.
customer_reviews.author: Michael Vayakornvichit

customer_reviews.title: Must have product.  Also keeps the mosquitos away.
customer_reviews.text: Just adding to the countless positive reviews for this product. If you own a grill, then this is a must have product. Stop using harmful fluids and buy this. You won't regret it. I take this everywhere I go and it works wonderfully. At around 20 minutes, you will have hot coals ready to cook. Another side effect of using this is that the smoke from the burning newspaper seems to keep the mosquitos away! Do be careful when you dump the hot coal though.
customer_reviews.author: Tsk Tsk Tsk

customer_reviews.title: Perfect accessory for a charcoal grill
customer_reviews.text: Works like a charm to get hardwood lump charcoal perfectly ready for the grill with no muss, no fuss, and NO STINKY LIGHTER FLUID. It's huge, so a full chimney's worth is enough to slow-grill a large roast. We use little firebug firestarters rather than paper to start the coals, as then you don't get any ash blowing around. It's worth every penny! They shipped this in the largest box imaginable, which was kind of funny - this giant box that weighed about a pound and a half. Kind of wasteful, but it arrived in perfect condition, which is probably why they do it that way.
customer_reviews.author: Geni P. Hawkins

customer_reviews.title: Almost magical
customer_reviews.text: I'd never used one of these before and was skeptical of the claims made. I got it and was amazed. All these years I've been using starting fuel to get my bar-b-cue going with all the inherent usual problems of smell and what to do if the briquettes don't start well initially. These chimney starters are almost magical. A couple sheets of newsprint, one match and 15 minutes later I'm ready to start cooking. It's so easy. I don't know how or why these things work so well but they do and most impressively, no fuel oil smell or danger.
customer_reviews.author: David AndersonTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Never going back to lighter fluid again.
customer_reviews.text: I have been positively amazed, and don't think I'll ever need lighter fluid again. Fill it up with charcoal, stick a couple pages of newspaper underneath, stick a corner or so out the openings on the bottom, light the newspaper and wait. The first time I was a little unsure if it was going to work, watching it and it didn't seem like it was catching on fire, I went inside and came back out fifteen minutes later and there was flames shooting six inches out of the top. Gets the charcoal burning evenly about as quickly as lighter fluid, and I think once it's burning evenly, it's burning hotter as well.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Bland

customer_reviews.title: 4 years later and still works
customer_reviews.text: I have had this product for 4 years now and have used it off and on with scout trips, camping, and just backyard BBQ, still works great, no rusting, no loose parts, i cant say enough good things about it. I plan on using it for decades to come.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Works perfectly! Easy!
customer_reviews.text: This thing works like a dream. I crumble up 2 sheets of paper in the base, fill the chimney with lump charcoal, and light a match in one of the holes on the side, or hold a lighter underneath til the paper catches. Then I just set it in the base of the grill for 5 minutes. Then you pour it into the grill. That’s it. Warning! It gets super hot! I know better. I do. BUT...... I set it on my grill tray for a second without thinking, and it burned right in!
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer Guerrero

customer_reviews.title: No more lighter fluid flavored food!
customer_reviews.text: For the longest time I used lighter fluid sprayed all over my charcoal to try and get a fire started, but then you are left with that lighter fluidy taste on your food. I first started seeing people using a chimney on BBQ Grillmasters. I bought one and have never looked back. It's super easy to start and the ready coals are good to go in about 10-15 mins. I have heard some people use their side burner on a gas grill to start their chimney, but I use the Weber 7417 Firestarter Lighter Cubes. They make starting a chimney a no brainer. Stop reading and buy this chimney, you won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: CLINT-THE-GREAT

customer_reviews.title: No more lighter fluid!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for Father's Day 2017. He has a fairly large pit. It's homemade and made of very thick steel. It usually takes an hour to get this pit ready to cook on using the traditional method. Bought him this, and within 15 minutes, the charcoal is ready. He pours it in the pit and lets it sit another 15 minutes and the pit is ready. Great buy. Highly recommended for anybody that uses charcoal. Just the money you save in lighter fluid is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: dollfacedbaby1

customer_reviews.title: So handy!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm not really sure what my husband did without his chimney starter! He is able to get the charcoal grill going much faster with this and it keeps everything contained right in the middle. I was a little nervous when it first came because it looked HUGE but he assured me that it was just right for our 22" Weber Kettle Grill. Very pleased with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Total Boy Mom

customer_reviews.title: I really like the large size
customer_reviews.text: I really like the large size. I hate the handle construction. The plastic part of the handle melted right off.
customer_reviews.author: Mark M. Sweeney

customer_reviews.title: great can
customer_reviews.text: Great starter. Just fill with charcoal and light some newspaper under the can and you'll have your coals in about 7-10 minutes. No fluid required. Follow up: I've recently scrolled down this comment section and saw a lot of poor reviews. I have to say, those people are very inexperienced with fires let alone barbecuing. The one person with a burned hand and their story... who light coals indoors? Wow. And then pour lighter flyid straight down from over the top. WOW x 2. Another one saying the handle gets hot. I always use this bare handed and never any problem. This is a great tool. Don't be led astray by these inexperienced people.
customer_reviews.author: Alex NYC

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMEND THIS STARTER!!
customer_reviews.text: I've used chimney starters before in the past but this is far and away THE BEST one I've used. I recently was able to snag a brand new Weber 26" Premium Charcoal Kettle Grill for $60 at a community sale so I've been buying all the bells and whistles for it. I used 2 sheets of newspaper crumpled into the bottom, filled the top with charcoal and lit the newspaper in 3 spots. Within 20 minutes the coals were ready and we grilled the best ribs for Super Bowl Sunday. I've always loved Weber products will continue to do so. This starter is an absolute must for any grilling enthusiast.
customer_reviews.author: Blue Dolphin

customer_reviews.title: I was amazed at how fast the coals were ready
customer_reviews.text: I was amazed at how fast the coals were ready. In fact, they were ready so fast that i missed out on cooking everything i needed. be aware of that - your coals may get hot and start cooling much sooner than you might expect. Also, i thought i bought one that was too big because i use the small Smokey Joe by Weber, but it was clearly the right size. i'm happy i won't have to taste lighter fluid on my food ever again.
customer_reviews.author: Rich

customer_reviews.title: Very efficient
customer_reviews.text: At first I found this to be a bit scary and intimidating because the charcoal is so hot, which is the point, of course. It had just been a while since I'd done anything with charcoal and had never done anything where I had to transfer it after it was hot. I've become comfortable with it although I still follow the directions carefully and handle with care. I love how efficiently it gets us ready to grill. I use a starter square so no fluid or wispy paper. Like anything with a grill, make sure to keep the kids and pets away from it.
customer_reviews.author: CW

customer_reviews.title: Just get it
customer_reviews.text: I have used cheaper versions, and they are nothing compared to this. Weber uses superior metal, it lasts longer than other brands, and it has more volume. Great product all around. Every time I buy a different brand, it is followed by regret.
customer_reviews.author: break_fix

customer_reviews.title: Works great as a chimney but the main handle gets too hot to touch with bare hands.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great chimney, holds a large volume and has good airflow to get the coal heated quickly and evenly. I bought this to replace a small cheap Walmart chimney I had originally that had the wooden handle fall off after one season. The uncovered wire top handle remains cool to the touch, however the plastic main handle becomes to hot to grab bare-handed. I have to use a leather work glove to pick it up.
customer_reviews.author: Jacob Starr

customer_reviews.title: this is a nice alternative but if you are going to reuse your ...
customer_reviews.text: Fill this one up and you have enough hot coals to fill both the charcoal holders on the large Weber grills. I have used fluid forever, this is a nice alternative but if you are going to reuse your unburned charcoal you will still need lighter fluid. One drawback if using crumpled newspaper as suggested to light under the charcoal is you will have a lot of loose paper soot floating around that you will want out of your grill before using. I have not tried it with the Weber FireStarters yet but will likely prefer those over the crumpled papers. Well built, big and rugged!
customer_reviews.author: kwitty

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Size and Very Durable
customer_reviews.text: We grill and smoke a lot and over the last few years we have gone through quite a few charcoal starters. Usually they get accidentally left out in the rain and rust badly or after much use the handle gets loose and falls off. We have had this one much longer than any of the other brands we have bought. It has spent many nights out in the rain and is not rusting apart. The handle is still solid. This chimney starter is slightly larger than many of the standard charcoal starters. The handle is much sturdier than the last few we have had. It works great with just the right amount of air flow to get the coals started.
customer_reviews.author: Kathy001

customer_reviews.title: Makes grilling easier and more fun.
customer_reviews.text: Makes charcoal lighting SO much easier. You dont need a 1/2 gallon of starter fluid with this thing. Put paper in the bottom, add the fire rocks, and light. Go inside and ten minutes later your fire rocks are ready to go. Dump them in the grill and spread out. Nice alternative to poking at a pile of charcoal and adding fluid while its already burning. Makes LOTS of smoke in the beginning. Just light and retreat to safety.
customer_reviews.author: theosus

customer_reviews.title: Beats the heck out of the old way!
customer_reviews.text: Never used one of these before but thought I would give it a try. What a nice surprise! You can light charcoal so much faster with this, and no lighter fluid! All you do is put some torn up cardboard or other material underneath, light it, and it does the rest, and very quickly. All the charcoal lights, so you don't waste any. Very dependable and it's all I use now!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A must-have for a charcoal grill. No need for ...
customer_reviews.text: A must-have for a charcoal grill. No need for lighter fluid whatsoever with this. You can start your chacoal grill with a few pieces of cardboard or newspaper and no tending whatsoever. Effortless starting and control because the end result is always red hot coals, so you can distribute heat more strategically. If you have a charcoal grill, don't think twice about this product. It pays for itself after one use with no fluid and no hassle.
customer_reviews.author: S

customer_reviews.title: Very efficient
customer_reviews.text: Along with the Weber start up cubes, this worked so well to get our coals cook ready. It took about 10-25 minutes for the coals to be ready on our medium grill. I laughingly say that the coals were almost too hot when ready as my husband burned some of our chicken. Our grill doesn't allow adjustments on the height, so beware that if cooking meat, you may want to start it in the oven. On a few pieces of our chicken the outside was CHARcoaled, and the inside was still raw. I'm sure if you are an experienced griller (which we are not), that you will be able to compensate for this problem. Happy Summer!
customer_reviews.author: Fallgirl

customer_reviews.title: Works Great.
customer_reviews.text: I'm very pleased with the 'Rapidfire Chimney Started', from Weber. I've already gotten quite a bit of use from it and find it functions much better than I expected. It's very easy to use and builds up a roaring fire, very quickly. And there's little to it except placing a sheet or two of newspaper in its bottom section, filling the upper section with briquettes necessary for your needs, lighting it from beneath, placing within the pit and after a few minutes emptying contents into the pit; works great.
customer_reviews.author: Bill Oterson

customer_reviews.title: Amazing! Only one thing to improve on.
customer_reviews.text: This has got to be the best product I've purchased all year long! It does exactly what it says it will! It's not complicated to use and it just simply works. The only thing I wish they can improve on is I want the coals to drop through the bottom of the chimney with the push of a button. It just seems dangerous pouring them. But I'll tell you I've tried other chimneys and they are horrible this one is the first one that does as advertised -- an Inferno I was worried about the plastic handle but it was cool to the touch! A true five-star product!
customer_reviews.author: David Ackley

customer_reviews.title: Excellent!
customer_reviews.text: I should have gotten this right when I got my Weber bbq - because it makes lighting the coals sooooo easy! forget about stupid lighter fluid and having to get the coals finally hot enough - this thing takes care of it! all you need are some lighter cubes (or even newspaper) at the bottom and all your coals will be red hot & ready to cook your meat in about 10-15 minutes (tops).
customer_reviews.author: Nikibeach

customer_reviews.title: A great chimney!
customer_reviews.text: A great chimney! Not sure why - the designs look to be identical - but the last chimney I had (no-name) was prone to fitful starting and/or going out before the briquettes got burning good. Not this bad boy. I can use the least expensive briquettes and get a good start every time with just a few pieces of newspaper. I have yet to be disappointed by a Weber product.
customer_reviews.author: tullamore92

customer_reviews.title: If you use a charcoal grill this is the best $15 you will ever spend
customer_reviews.text: This is the simplest review possible: the Chimney Starter is the most elegant solution to the age-old problem of lighting charcoal one can imagine. A simple cylinder of aluminum (that heats up and cools down quickly) containing a steel-coil bottom, supporting a column of charcoal, which uses convection to suck air into a concentrated mass of fuel and turn it into glowing coals within 15 minutes. No lighter fluid, no mess, no blowing, no singed eyebrows. I have a graduate degree in fluid mechanics and heat transfer so this incredibly simple item is a particular work of art to me.
customer_reviews.author: Bill

customer_reviews.title: Wow.  Great device.  Easy.  Fast.  Efficient
customer_reviews.text: Wow. I had never used one of these before. To say it works great is not giving it sufficient credit. Could not be easier. I just used one of the small fire starter cubes. I put the cube on the bottom of the grill, lit the cube and then put the Chimney on top, and immediately the charcoal let into a furnace. It did not take more than :10 for all ready to pout into the grill. Great device.
customer_reviews.author: Coolfire

customer_reviews.title: Worth the dough ($$) makes y'all a PRO!!
customer_reviews.text: These really work well. Use crunched up newspaper, not those fuel starter tabs. Use 3 or 4 full page newspaper balls stuffed on the bottom, set this tower on the charcoal grid, dump some briquettes (I prefer real charcoal, c'mon, be a MAN!) and light UNDERNEATH THE TOWER. Wait till a y'all see some lower charcoal glowing then USE GLOVES or a very quick hand to dump the tower onto the charcoal grid. Add to the starter pile for a honest bed of cooking coals. Take a bow after serving!.....pete
customer_reviews.author: Peter Spence

customer_reviews.title: Bought Two of These Things... For Good Reason
customer_reviews.text: This is the second chimney that I bought from weber. The reason for replacing was because I had to give one to my parents, because they have been using gas, paper, and all sorts of ridiculous and antiquated methods of lighting their coals for years. A full chimney will usually get me through a grill of 3-4 steaks, shrimp, veggies, and a slow roast of sweet potatoes after all that is done on a 26" Weber one-touch. I also own the smaller version of this same chimney and I'll use that to get the smoker going or for smaller grills. Stop doing it wrong and just buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Albert H. Lee

customer_reviews.title: Charcoal Grilling Necessity
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing! This chimney starter makes short work of any kind of charcoal I've put in it, whether it's been Kingsford briquettes or natural lump charcoal. I'm not exaggerating in the slightest when I say this is orders of magnitude faster and more convenient than trying to light your charcoal in the grill. When you're out camping and you need to get your food cooked quickly, don't futz around with the lighter fluid. Load this bad boy up and light up some crumpled newspaper underneath, and you'll be cooking in no time.
customer_reviews.author: Shawn

customer_reviews.title: LIfe-testing another Weber Chimney Starter
customer_reviews.text: I have used one for over 11 years and age/rust/use/weather finally caught up with my Weber Chimney Starter. My poor overused one had a burn-through in the side, but the last straw was when picking it up full of hot coals, the handle broke loose on the top of the unit. Luckily I managed to dump the coals in the burn box and not on the ground or myself. So I am off to life test another Weber Chimney Starter.....
customer_reviews.author: Dwight Dolliver

customer_reviews.title: Quality Weber chimney at the cost of the cheap Chinese knockoffs.
customer_reviews.text: After using a cheap Chinese knockoff for about a year before it rusted through in several places, I found this Weber chimney for just a few dollars more than the cheap-o that it replaced. What a huge difference!!! This thing gets the coals up to temperature MUCH faster then the cheap one did. This gets you much longer charcoal burn time at cooking temperature, and get's you cooking a good 10 minutes faster. Amazon's price is about half what you will find this for in the big box stores, and will save you the gas money by having it shipped right to your door! I couldn't be happier.
customer_reviews.author: 1down5up

customer_reviews.title: Fast and natural
customer_reviews.text: I grew using lighter fluid to start bbq's and learned about this technique and it is so much more easier and better tasting for the food. It takes usually about 15 minutes from start to finish to get a good solid fire going inside this thing, but it is really easy to use, just use caution with moving the item and dumping the coals into the bbq, you may get a flame coming out around your hand. Also, because very careful not to leave it unattended or around children. Common sense stuff, but it is something I really stress with this product. Otherwise, this is a great simple and easy to use fire starter, and no lighter fluid needed!
customer_reviews.author: Yvette Ortega

customer_reviews.title: Such a great coal starter
customer_reviews.text: Such a great coal starter. It's easy to get going with few sheets of newspaper on the bottom and coal on top. You are set with hot coal in 15min and ready to grill. It does get a little smoky in the first 5 min, so put it down wind. It held up with lots of use and being neglected in the rain. I highly recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: jmumv

customer_reviews.title: Best way to start your charcoal!
customer_reviews.text: Far better than lighter fluid or Matchlight (yuck). Only downside is, it doesn't last long. Bought my second one a little over a year ago, and just received my third from Amazon. I use it a lot, grill most of my meals during the warm months. I've probably used the one in the pictures about 150 times. See the photos for a comparison. I do fill it up so my fire probably runs hotter than the manual states.
customer_reviews.author: Seven of Nine

customer_reviews.title: Chimney starters are the greatest boon to outdoor grilling since the invention of charcoal
customer_reviews.text: What can you say about this that hasn't already been said? Chimney starters are the greatest boon to outdoor grilling since the invention of charcoal. This is one of the best starters. It's very large and holds a lot of charcoal. The handle is far away from the body. There is a heat shield between the body and the handle. The wire bail makes dumping the coals easier. My only nit pick is that the vent holes on the bottom are not large enough to fit a long handled lighter into. So you have to tip the chimney to light it underneath. Not really a deal breaker by any means.
customer_reviews.author: LMSAND

customer_reviews.title: It works well and safely.
customer_reviews.text: America's Test Kitchen recommended this one as it has a large capacity, and an extra handle to keep from getting burned when transferring hot coals to the grill. It was my first time to use one and I'm seriously impressed.
customer_reviews.author: Barbara Holly

customer_reviews.title: BBQ Guru Approved!!!  This Pit Master gives the "yes" nod for a quality, dependable product!  Rapid Fire for sure!
customer_reviews.text: This chimney starter is amazing! Good bye lighter fluid! I have a somewhat smaller charcoal grill that I take with me camping and on picnics for small group entertaining (skewered morsels, steaks, etc). This chimney is so big I only fill it about half full for use with the smaller grill. I also have a standard size grill that I use in my backyard and it's capacity perfectly accommodates the correct amount of charcoal and has it ready for cooking in not more than 15 minutes. It really does only require two sheets of newspaper. In closing, stop thinking about it and just get one!!!
customer_reviews.author: R. L. Tigner

customer_reviews.title: I am happy to say I was wrong
customer_reviews.text: I've seen this type of charcoal starter for years and felt it was just another accessory to stow away. I am happy to say I was wrong. I ordered this starter from Amazon a few days ago after getting a new Weber Kettle and I have determined it functions as advertised. Ignite with two pieces of newspaper and simply walk away. In just a few minutes your hot coals are ready for the cooking grate. Liquid starter and other methods are a thing of the past with this product. It appears to be durable also.
customer_reviews.author: Ed Lee

customer_reviews.title: Key to my success
customer_reviews.text: I could not, for the life of me, get a decent fire going on my new BBQ until I got one of these. They wanted $24 for a smaller one at Lowes so I came to Amazon and I'm glad I did. A few sheets of newspaper, a dribble of olive oil as another reviewer suggested, and I have an inferno of briquettes in seconds. I even used it on the pile of partially used briquettes left over from my last failed pyramid attempt. It does get very hot so you need gloves or pot holders when dumping out.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda B.

customer_reviews.title: Well built, makes life easy
customer_reviews.text: If you bbq with charcoal or wood this is amazing. Smoked 80lbs of meat last weekend. I filled this up half way with charcoal, crumpled up newspaper underneath and a lighter fluid squirt. Light it 5 min later hot coals, dumped into the firebox and stacked some logs. Done pit was smoking in less than 10 min. Wish I got this year's ago. The quality of this is great, good sturdy construction. Unlike a lot of others I have looked at. The heat shield is nice makes moving when lit easy and pain free.
customer_reviews.author: Ian M

customer_reviews.title: Great product. I wish I would have purchased one ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product. I wish I would have purchased one of these years ago. I use paper towels or newspaper (when I remember to save it) in the bottom and then light it and wait for about 10-15 minutes until the coals are ready. The only difference between this one and more expensive starters are this one does not have a release bottom. Which means you have to turn it over when the coals are ready. Not a big deal, but probably a good idea to use heat resistant gloves of some sort if you're worried. Awesome product!
customer_reviews.author: Brandon

customer_reviews.title: Love this big, well-fabricated chimney
customer_reviews.text: I have a pretty large smoker/grill and was really unsatisfied with the only chimney my local "House Warehouse" had on the shelf. I think the Weber 7416 is a few bucks extra but well worth it. This chimney fires up all your coals, not just enough to lay down starter coals and throw more on 'em. I think I fit almost a half bag of Kingsford and burn a few sheets of paper under it. 15 minutes later, I'm layin' down coals and warmin' up to cook.
customer_reviews.author: Jim Sr.

customer_reviews.title: Ditch the lighter fluid, buy this NOW
customer_reviews.text: This is a must have for any charcoal grill. So much better then spraying lighter fluid, and having that cook into your food. You fill the top part of the chimney with charcoal... You can up to 30 coals in there. Put two pieces of newspaper under the bottom and light it. 15 minutes later you have perfect roasting coals for a charcoal grill. The handle is designed for two hand use, so you don't burn yourself. The quality is top notch, and you will get great use from it.
customer_reviews.author: Craig G.

customer_reviews.title: This product is best used to refill charcoal when the initial load begins ...
customer_reviews.text: I initially doubted that this product would work, but quickly learned that this is a priceless item to have when grilling large quantities of food. This product is best used to refill charcoal when the initial load begins to die out. Starting the chimney with a small amount of newspaper easily gets the coals going. The handles allow for an easy transfer of hot coals to the grill.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: Just about perfect
customer_reviews.text: Charcoal chimneys are not new or revolutionary - we used to build them out of old coffee cans as kids - but this one has a brilliant design improvement. The conical grate in the bottom is genius. Not one time in dozens of uses has my charcoal failed to light. The design allows a lot more briquet surface area to be exposed to the flame. This thing is awesome, and very well constructed. Should last a long time. I'd give it 6 stars if I could.
customer_reviews.author: Spencer James

customer_reviews.title: What a great product
customer_reviews.text: My brother turned me onto the charcoal chimney by Weber. You don't need to buy the more expensive easy light charcoal or drown your coals in starter fluid. You simply fill the chimney with regular charcoal, set it in your grill and wadd up a couple of pieces of newspaper and stuff it under the bottom of the chimney and light the newspaper. It is amazing how quickly your coals are glowing red, you then just dump the coals into the grill and avoid the chemicals associated with lighting your grill. Whoever came up with this idea really developed a great product and it's only about $20. You will not be sorry you bought this product.
customer_reviews.author: Charles Harris

customer_reviews.title: Must buy, if you are a serious outdoor cook!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is amazing! Just don't touch the metal lol... You just fill with charcoal, crumple up 2 pieces of newspaper and lite em up... 15 min later, I dump it in my firebox on my smoker, and no more lighter fluid taste (if you smoke, you know that's sacrilege lol... Just be sure to dump the coals onto your cooking platform rapidly, as heat rises, very quickly, especially at these temps... I simply could not go without it at this point, completely satisfied and I recommend the heck out of this!
customer_reviews.author: Gregory Fairlamb

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm, but hate plastic handles
customer_reviews.text: Its a pretty big size, and I hate that they make these chimney starters with plastic handles now instead of wood. (they also do the same with some of the Weber Grills) You may notice the plastic getting a little melted if you leave the chimney too long. but it does work really fast! I havent had any big problems with it yet (nothing melted off), so pretty happy
customer_reviews.author: E schutt

customer_reviews.title: Get one!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is flat awesome! Works about twice as fast as one I bought and repaired multiple times from one of the big box stores. It also holds much more for times I need a bigger pile of coals. I light mine over the side burner on my grill and that works perfect! No lighter fluid and no newspaper mess. Also works just as well with newspaper or charcoal bag torn up while camping. It also looks like it will hold up longer and avoid rusting which is what kept causing issues with the other version I had prior to this one. Buy it! You won't be disappointed!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy C

customer_reviews.title: Well worth it, best Weber accessory I've used
customer_reviews.text: I never realized how poorly started my old flames were until I used this beast. It's bigger than I thought, holds enough for a full size weber grill (18 - 19" diameter). I've been a charcoal weber user for over 20 years! Starts fast with small fire starter, and you can start cooking as soon as all coals are lit. Hottest fire ever, cooks better than lighter fluid starts. The only downside is getting the old coals into this cylinder to start it up again.
customer_reviews.author: Matthew R. Peddicord

customer_reviews.title: A must have for charcoal fans!
customer_reviews.text: Great performing chimney starter. I saved up a bunch of packing paper from our last move and two sheets has started coals every time without fail. Very easy to use, practically fool proof, and gets coals burning hot very effectively in all types of weather. The heat shield and handle work extremely well, too, as I can dump the coals using bare hands (probably should have some on to stay on the safe side, but I haven't had any issues). Wish I had invested in one earlier!
customer_reviews.author: stooker

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE tool for your BBQ arsenal
customer_reviews.text: Wow...why did I not do this before? Took me less than 15 minutes to get the grill started last time...all by myself. Also, this preps a lot of coals, and the handles make it easy to dump them where needed. I guess the cone design helps. Don't know the reasons WHY, I just like the results! Has held up well with regular use for the season, and fully expect it to last many more. The chimney starter makes it easy and FAST...won't grill without it!
customer_reviews.author: Lauren W

customer_reviews.title: Love this chimney!
customer_reviews.text: This has made a huge difference for my grilling! I used to have a chimney started that I bought for cheap at Wally world. It works but it took way longer and I had to fan it a lot so it'd get all the coals going. The design in the Weber is perfect, the bottom grate and the cone shape plus all the holes makes this a breeze to get the coals started. Do yourself a favor and get this for your best grilling experience.
customer_reviews.author: Mr Mustacho

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I love chimney starters and this one is by far the best I've ever bought. It is way bigger than the other ones I've owned and can hold so much more charcoal. It's easy to use and pretty easy to dump. Because it's bigger, I had trouble dumping it the first couple times (weak wrists) but with practice it got easier and I don't plan on going back to the smaller ones. The handles are nicely placed and they don't get too hot. For safety, I always use oven mitts anyway but it's still a nice touch.
customer_reviews.author: Brittany

customer_reviews.title: Big and works great!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my parents for when I was planning on stopping by home to make them some bbq chicken. This worked like a charm and made me wish I had a grill at home. Throw in your charcoal, shove one or two pages of newspapers on the bottom, and light. You are ready to go in 10-15 mins. It is amazing how well this sucker works. Remember that this is pretty big (which is why it is great due to the amount of coals you can put in it) so if you don't have a need for 4-5 quarts of charcoal at one time, maybe you should look for a smaller starter.
customer_reviews.author: Dchon

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! This was a fun purchase over the summer
customer_reviews.text: HIGHLY RECOMMENDED! This was a fun purchase over the summer... my wife dislike propane gas -as she claimed she can taste the gas in the food, so it's always a hassle to lit the grills. These things are made by a company I did not know about "WEBER." Almost every guess that came over for BBQ over the summer mentioned that WEBER is a top-of-the-line company with top-of-line-products. Well... they are right. This thing is VERY WELL MADE. Heavy-duty and it's heavy. Now, we place a handful of charcoal inside, go to the kitchen stove, and in seconds (about a minute or so) all the charcoal inside are red hot.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph Montague

customer_reviews.title: Every griller/smoker needs this!
customer_reviews.text: This chimney is much wider than your conventional one you buy at the grocery store or WalSamCoscoMart. The extra vent slots on the bottom as well the vent holes along the side really do a good job of allowing air flow to stimulate burning capacity. A small trick I read somewhere else was to add a small amount of vegetable oil to the paper at the bottom for a more rapid, longer burning initial flame. Because the chimney is wider, you can add more starter fuel to the bottom and more coal/wood to the chimney. I always hated having to add more fresh coals after pouring out the chimney.
customer_reviews.author: Vegas Strong

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Chimney
customer_reviews.text: Purchased one of these for our most recent camping trip. Made multiple meals using this chimney. Every time we had easy, fast ignition of the coals. Produced quick, hot coals for our meals. Quality is better than the ones on the shelf at our local supermarket and outdoor stores. Highly recommend. Warning: The metal that attaches the handle to the actual chimney gets very hot. If you slip and place your fingers on this you will get burned. The plastic handle does not get hot though. Using the main plastic handle and the second accessory handle made maneuvering very easy.
customer_reviews.author: Mark

customer_reviews.title: Great Product!
customer_reviews.text: This product is a must have for anyone with a charcoal grill. I have tried electric starters before and they simply just do not work as well as this device. Starting the grill used to take me a lot of time and effort and now it is a breeze. It has transformed my grilling experience. Once a mundane and tedious task is now super easy. As for the durability, there is some major discoloring from the heat, but it has not effected the functionality at all. Plus it has not rusted even after being outside for a couple of months now.
customer_reviews.author: Caleb

customer_reviews.title: A great addition to any Pit-masters bag of tricks.
customer_reviews.text: A great addition to any BBQ grill. Works exceptionally well - heating charcoal in about 15 minutes. Made of sturdy heavy weight sheet metal with 2 handles for easy and safe handling. Eliminates the need for chemicals to light your charcoal grill thereby keeping undesirable tastes and odors off your food. The strangest thing is that it arrived packed in a Walmart box. Very satisfied with this purchase and highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Buckeye HD Rider

customer_reviews.title: No more lighter fluid for me
customer_reviews.text: Can't believe I've been missing out on using this - been grilling for years and only just recently decided to try this because I was tired of disposing of used lighter fluid bottles properly. Used it for the first time today and my hardwood coal was fully lit in about 15mins. I think I'm done using lighter fluid at this point. Would be nice if it was just a bit bigger, but I suppose I can just use 2 of I need fully light my 22" grill.
customer_reviews.author: ode2dave

customer_reviews.title: No more Fuel Oil taste on your Food
customer_reviews.text: Love these chimneys. They are very built and are efficient and they work very well. I have owned another just like this one I just bought for past 6 years so bought a second one for a vacation home. Best part about these chimeny's is that they will start a full chimney of charcoal in about 20-25 minutes with just 2 sheets of crumpled newspaper and No More fuel oil taste on your meats/vegetables Note when starting: just use 2 sheets of broadsheet newspaper....not 1 not 3 or more but... 2 sheets, only of dry newspaper. It will start perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Best investment all year
customer_reviews.text: How have I grilled/bbq-ed without one of these all my life!! Best investment all year. Load the chimney with coal, have some tinder in the bottom, and 10-15min later (or when the flames die down), Pour out the coal evenly in the grill or on one side (your choice) and you're set!!
customer_reviews.author: M Ing

customer_reviews.title: A must have.
customer_reviews.text: Works exactly as described. Makes grilling out so much more pleasurable. No long wait for fire to start. Easy to use. I would purchase this again. This also makes a great gift for Father’s day, birthday, etc.
customer_reviews.author: Kat A.

customer_reviews.title: Great product, highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic product! I followed the directions and crumpled two pieces of newspaper into the bottom then I filled it about half full with briquettes. One match on a cold windy evening and it lit. Within minutes I had flames shooting two feet out the top of the chimney! The handle was still cool, and bare-handed (the instructions caution using a glove at this point!) I carefully poured the briquettes out into the grill. Be very careful of sparks when you do this. The briquettes were glowing red! This works far better than any other chimney I've used and far far better than any lighter fluid! Highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Mark C

customer_reviews.title: The first one held together beautifully but rusted inside and out
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Weber chimney in about 5 years. The first one held together beautifully but rusted inside and out, entirely at the fault of my husband. It continued to do its job though! When we upgraded his grill for his birthday this year, I went ahead and got him a bright and shiny new chimney to go with it. It's sturdy and secure, both times over, and a great value at $16. I have purchased 2 more of these for grilling gift sets and I continue to recommend them!
customer_reviews.author: Wine MamaTop Contributor: Cooking

product_meta.title: Weber 7416 Rapidfire Chimney Starter
product_meta.description: Style:Chimney StarterGet your charcoal glowing and ready to go in just minutes with the Weber Rapid fire Chimney Charcoal Starter. Tackle high-volume cooking with the extra-large capacity bin. It's made from aluminized steel.
feature_bullets: Chimney starter system lights charcoal quickly and evenly
Made from aluminized steel with a stay-cool thermoplastic handle
Holds enough briquettes for a 22-1/2-inch kettle grill
Cone bottom ensures a fast start; eliminates need for lighter fluid

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.8 out of 5 stars9,530 ratings4.8 out of 5 stars
